Ad Text:
About us:
Snackbrands Australia is part of Intersnack Group, a private German snack food company founded in 1968. Although internationally owned we are still very much a local company Creating Happy Snacking Moments for everyone!


Here at Snack Brands Australia, we proudly make some of Australia’s favourite snacks including Kettle, CC’s, Thins, Cheezels, The Natural Chip Company and Nice & Natural. Across our three sites, we make over 200 million packets of chips a year - that's a lot of enjoyment and fun we bring to snackers every day! We encourage a culture that is exciting, challenging and we strive for innovation in everything we do. Our aim is for our people to share in our success, enjoy our products and reap the benefits of their hard work within a supportive environment where work life balance is encouraged!


About the role:


We’re seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst – Finance to join our IT Applications team and lead the delivery of D365 Finance projects, enhancements and support for our Finance function. If you’re a strong communicator who thrives on solving complex financial system challenges, this role is your opportunity to make a real impact.



This role will be based at our head office in Norwest with regular travel to our manufacturing site at Orchard Hills.

What you’ll be responsible for:
Develop, execute and lead unit, system and user testing as required to implement changes into production
Support Finance users including production problems, incidents and change requests i.e. manage and resolve open tickets in your support queue.
Follow ITIL processes and methodologies for approval and migration of changes to production.
Work with vendors to provide support and upgrade information.
Analyse, troubleshoot and resolve issues across Microsoft D365 Finance modules, collaborating with IT and business stakeholders.
Deliver Finance related D365 projects and enhancements on budget and aligned to business goals.
Work closely with Finance leaders to ensure solutions meet operational and compliance requirements.
Plan, monitor and report project performance
Build strong relationships across business functions and positively influence best-practice solution design.
Ensure compliance with broader IT strategy and architecture.

What you’ll bring to the role:
Proven experience as a Senior BA – Finance, ideally within FMCG.
Excellent Dynamics 365 and business process knowledge in Finance and Operations.
Solution knowledge of Dynamics 365, SQL data base and integration technologies.
Ability to research and facilitate D365 application solutions to meet business requirements
Excellent knowledge of quality assurance and security related to D365 applications.
Strong stakeholder management, negotiation and communication skills.
Ability to prepare business cases, estimates and project documentation.
Strong analytical, commercial and systems-thinking capability.
Experience managing multiple priorities across functions with conflicting requirements.
Knowledge of high-volume transaction and billing systems is an advantage.


What can you expect in return?
A supportive working environment (with plenty of snacks on hand!) where you'll feel engaged and valued, career growth, Birthday Leave, Access to discounts on Retailers, onsite parking (including electric car charging stations) and a focus on health and wellness (like Wellbeing Days!) to make your workplace more enjoyable!




**Our application process includes an Application Form that will be emailed to you directly after your submission. Please ensure you check your junk inbox for this application form, as only applications with this form will be considered. Thank you

Company Description
Lead the University’s market research and insights function, delivering high-impact intelligence that shapes strategic decisions and drives institutional growth.
Partner with senior leaders to translate complex data into actionable strategies, influencing program development, recruitment, and marketing investment.
Collaborate with academic and professional leaders to embed market insights into program design, portfolio planning, and student recruitment strategies.

Western Sydney University is a modern, world-class institution located in the heart of Australia's fastest growing and most economically significant region. With nearly 50,000 students, approximately 3,500 staff, and a network of campuses across Greater Western Sydney, Vietnam, and Indonesia, we are proud to be ranked among the top two per cent of universities globally.

This is your opportunity to be part of something bigger. By joining Western Sydney University, you become a valued member of our community. As our region changes, so too does our university. Western is boldly different, energetic, global, diverse, dynamic, and youthful.

Our mission is to deliver student success, impactful research, and stronger communities. As part of our team, you will have a stake in shaping the future of education, broadening horizons, and changing lives. Making a difference starts at Western.

The Opportunity

The Senior Manager, Market Research and Insights leads and directs the University’s market research and insights function within the Future Students, Marketing and Communications portfolio. The role has responsibility for shaping how market evidence is generated, interpreted, and applied to guide strategic decision-making across the University.

By delivering authoritative analysis of market demand, competitor activity, and student behaviour, the Senior Manager ensures the University is positioned to anticipate change, seize opportunities, and mitigate risks. The role works in partnership with senior leaders and academic stakeholders to embed insights into program development, portfolio planning, student recruitment, and marketing investment, ensuring decisions are demand-led and aligned to the University’s long-term priorities.

This is a full-time (35-hour week), fixed-term 5-year position based at our Parramatta South campus, with hybrid working arrangements available.

Please refer to the Position Description for further information.

About You

You are a strategic market research and insights leader passionate about shaping evidence-based decision-making and driving institutional growth. You thrive in complex, fast-paced environments, translating sophisticated data into clear, actionable strategies that empower senior leaders and academic stakeholders. Your collaborative approach and commercial acumen enable you to build trust, influence outcomes, and deliver measurable impact across the University.

You will bring:

Postgraduate qualifications in a relevant discipline, or extensive senior-level experience in market research, strategy, or institutional research within large, complex organisations.
Demonstrated success in leading market insights functions that directly inform organisational strategy, investment decisions, and program or portfolio development.
Advanced analytical expertise, with proven ability to lead complex modelling, benchmarking, competitor analysis, and demand forecasting at scale.
High-level capability in synthesising and communicating complex data for executive audiences and governance forums.
Proven experience advising and influencing senior leaders, with excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Strong leadership and people management capability, with a track record of developing high-performing teams and building institutional capability in evidence-based planning.
Commercial acumen and a sophisticated understanding of higher education industry dynamics, recruitment markets, and the evolving regulatory landscape.
Sound judgement, resilience, and the ability to deliver results in environments of complexity, change, and ambiguity.

Desirable:

Experience partnering with external research providers, industry bodies, or government stakeholders.
Familiarity with advanced analytics tools, data visualisation platforms, or emerging research technologies.
Professional membership or certification in market research, analytics, or related fields.

Why Join Us?

At Western Sydney University, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the University’s strategic direction, delivering market intelligence that drives evidence-based decisions and positions us for future growth. You’ll collaborate with passionate colleagues, engage with senior leaders and diverse stakeholders, and contribute to the University’s mission of excellence and innovation.

You’ll have the opportunity to:

Lead a high-impact market research and insights function that informs program development, portfolio strategy, and marketing priorities.
Work in a dynamic, supportive environment that values analytical thinking, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Make a meaningful difference in a region renowned for its diversity, ambition, and energy.

Join us and help shape the future of Western Sydney University through the power of market insights.

Remuneration Package: An attractive senior remuneration package will be provided. 

Position Enquiries: Please direct specific enquiries regarding the role to Andrew Younis, Chief Marketing Officer via a.younis@westernsydney.edu.au.

Recruitment Enquiries: For any recruitment-related enquiries, please email the Talent Acquisition team at talentacquisitionteam@westernsydney.edu.au.

Closing Date: Wednesday, 17 December 2025 at 11:59pm.

Working Rights in Australia - Eligibility  

Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. For an ongoing/continuing position, you must be an Australian or New Zealand citizen or an Australian Permanent Resident and provide evidence at the time of application.  

Please note that only applications submitted via the University’s online recruitment system will be considered. 

Additional Information

Please only advertise for 1 week.

NOTE FROM BECK :  I'm on leave next week 29 Sept - 2 October. Please contact Andrew Younis on Teams to confirm any details.

Our client

We are partnered with a Global Technology firm with ambitious expansion plans in the APAC region. You will be joining an established and growing business with scope for significant growth and expansion in local markets.

Your career growth will be accelerated with key responsibilities and mandates to enable the business meets targets and adapts to an evolving landscape.

About the Role

We are seeking a dynamic and strategic Head of FP&A to support to join our leadership team. This senior role is pivotal in shaping enterprise-wide financial planning, drive pricing strategy, and supporting transaction activities. You will partner closely with executive leadership, commercial teams, and corporate development to deliver data-driven insights that enhance profitability, strengthen decision-making, and enable sustainable growth across both organic initiatives and M&A activities.

What You'll Do

Shape the company's financial future by leading the design of budgets, forecasts, and long-term planning that align with strategic goals.
Provide executives with sharp, actionable insights through scenario modelling, performance reviews, and financial storytelling.
Act as a bridge between operations and finance, ensuring business strategies translate into measurable financial outcomes.
Modernise and streamline FP&A processes by championing automation, governance, and smarter systems.
Build pricing frameworks that balance competitiveness with profitability, enabling sustainable growth.
Partner with Sales, Marketing, and Product teams to evaluate pricing proposals, promotions, and commercial opportunities.
Assess customer and market dynamics to refine pricing strategies and strengthen margin performance.
Support negotiations with robust financial modelling and clear recommendations that weigh risks and rewards.
Work hand-in-hand with Corporate Development on acquisitions and investments, from due diligence to integration planning.
Monitor post-deal results to ensure investments deliver on their promises.
Lead and inspire a high-performing FP&A and pricing team, fostering collaboration and capability development.
Serve as a trusted advisor to senior leadership, influencing decisions with strategic financial guidance.
Drive a culture of continuous improvement, data-driven decision-making, and cross-functional alignment.

What You'll Bring

Demonstrated expertise in FP&A, commercial finance, and M&A support at a senior leadership level
Strong communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders across all levels
Advanced proficiency in financial systems, Enterprise Planning Tools and expert-level Excel capability
CA, CPA and CFA all highly regarded
Strategic thinker with strong commercial judgement and analytical rigour
Proven leadership capability with a focus on developing and empowering teams
Ability to build trusted stakeholder relationships and influence outcomes
Adaptable, agile, and effective in fast-paced, dynamic environments

Apply Now

Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button.

Learn more about our Melbourne recruitment services: http://www.roberthalf.com.au/recruitment-agency-melbourne

Job Ref: 06810-0013345436SG

By clicking 'apply', you give your express consent that Robert Half may use your personal information to process your job application and to contact you from time to time for future employment opportunities. For further information on how Robert Half processes your personal information and how to access and correct your information, please read the Robert Half privacy notice: https://www.roberthalf.com/au/en/privacy. Please do not submit any sensitive personal data to us in your resume (such as government ID numbers, ethnicity, gender, religion, marital status or trade union membership) as we do not collect your sensitive personal data at this time.

Corporate Analyst


About ARTC

We're one of the country's largest rail network owners, proud to be keeping the future of transport on track.

A vital link in the nation's transport supply chain, every day our people manage the movement of over 415 freight and passenger trains across five states, 9,600km of track, 39 worksites and the lands of more than 50 First Nations. Rail isn't just a mode of transport, it's a safer and more environmentally friendly choice. We're committed to expanding and modernising our rail network, having invested billions of dollars to ensure its efficiency and sustainability. Join us and be part of a team that's shaping the future of transport in Australia.

About the Team

When you join the Corporate Finance team, you'll be joining the cornerstone of our operations, providing crucial guidance and governance to support ARTC's strategic objectives. The team is actively engaged in internal planning to enhance our strategic planning, risk management, and decision-making processes.

Our Finance team are trusted advisors, working hand in hand with all facets of our organisation to drive excellence and innovation. Their commitment and expertise are key pillars in ARTC's journey towards a more sustainable, efficient, and successful future.

About the Opportunity

This role is pivotal in supporting ARTC's long term commercial decision making processes, facilitating corporate reporting that support insightful long-term plans and thinking. Reporting to the Manager, Corporate reporting & Analysis you will be tasked with drafting high-quality presentations for the Board as well as commercial and financial modelling which will support investments and project decision making.

Specific responsibilities include:

Support and participate in projects and initiatives that are related to financial management and performance reporting including KPI's and benchmarking activities.
In conjunction with the Manager, Corporate Reporting & Analysis, drive a focus on Commercial Decision Support and Investment Evaluation across ARTC including:

Co-ordinating Financial Due Diligence in respect of major investments including input from accounting, taxation and treasury teams.
Modelling the treasury, funding and valuation implications of major investments.
Further the Development of Investment Evaluation frameworks in ARTC.
Partnering with operational teams to understand assessment and value of risk in transaction cash flows.
Facilitate evidence-based decision making in setting performance targets and in managing ongoing reporting while ensuring consistency in data across various reporting frameworks including corporate plan, balanced scorecard and in Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) Reporting.
Support the continuous improvement on reporting, ensuring value add and linkages to performance monitoring and broader strategic intent.

What do we want from you?

The Corporate Finance team support every aspect of ARTC's diverse and complex operating environment, as such, we expect all our team members have an enquiring mind and strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills. High level commercial, modelling, analytical and reporting skills are a prerequisite and must be demonstrated in your career history. Advanced Excel skills are required and are complimented by your compelling written reporting capability.

Appropriate tertiary qualifications will ideally be supported by CPA/CA qualifications or their near completion.

What will you get from us?

Talk to us about flexible working options
Competitive remuneration
Resources to support your health and wellbeing and development
Novated leasing options, as well as discounts and support programs
24/7 Employee Assistance Program for all employees and their direct family members

Our Organisation and Culture

At ARTC, we're more than just a rail network. We're a team of dedicated professionals committed to keeping Australia moving forward. Our culture is one of inclusion & collaboration, and continuous improvement. We're focused on growth, not just for our business but for our people and our country.

In everything we do, safety is our top priority. We believe in providing a safe workplace where everyone can thrive. Our commitment to safety is not just a statement; it's a fundamental part of who we are and enables us to best serve our customers and communities.

Our people are at the heart of our success. We value their expertise, their passion, and their dedication. We invest in their development and empower them to make a difference. Together, we are building a future where rail is the preferred mode of transport, contributing to a cleaner, safer, and more sustainable Australia.

Join us at ARTC and be a part of a team that's shaping the future of transport in Australia.

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent.

Apply Now

Join the exciting future of rail today and find a career for life.

As part of the application process, you'll be required to undergo pre-employment criminal history, reference, and medical checks, including drug and alcohol testing.

Applications close: Wednesday 17 December 2025

Note: ARTC reserve the right to progress applications prior to the closing date.

Ready to take the next step in your data career?

Cadence Connect have partnered exclusively with a leading Brisbane-based organisation embarking on a major data transformation journey. We’re looking for a Data Engineer ready to step up into a leadership position or a Team Leader wanting a change.

This is a rare opportunity to combine hands-on technical work with genuine ownership, mentoring, and influence. You’ll help shape the future of the company’s cloud data environment while working alongside a highly skilled, long-tenured team.

About the Role

You’ll lead and mentor a small team of Data Engineers, Analysts, and BI Developers, while remaining 30–40% hands-on across projects. The business is currently transitioning from on-prem systems to a modern, cloud-based architecture built on Microsoft Fabric, Azure, and Power BI.

You’ll be key in designing and delivering data integrations, migrations, and automation solutions that unlock business value.

Key Responsibilities

Oversee the end-to-end data lifecycle – ingestion, integration, storage, transformation, and visualisation
Lead the migration from on-prem to cloud (MS Fabric / Databricks / Snowflake)
Mentor and guide team members, promoting collaboration and technical excellence
Deliver key data projects including OCR automation (Python), Power Platform apps, and AI enablement (Copilot)
Partner with business stakeholders to improve data accessibility and reporting outcomes
About You

✔ Strong background as a Data Engineer or Integration Specialist
✔ Experience across SQL, Power BI, and cloud-based platforms
✔ Exposure to data warehousing, lakehouse design, or ETL/ELT pipelines
✔ Proven ability to solve problems, motivate others, and deliver outcomes
✔ Ready to take the next step into a leadership position

For more information, please reach out to tom@cadenceconnect.com.au

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Permanent Position - Australian Diversified Financial Services Company
CBD Location - Hybrid Working Arrangement
Uplift Business Analyst Capability

The role:
We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to play a pivotal role in strengthening our BA practice, uplifting standards, and driving consistent, high-quality analysis across the business. This role will suit someone who is not only technically strong but passionate about coaching, mentoring and embedding best-practice frameworks.

Your responsibilities will include:

Lead end-to-end business analysis across complex programs and initiatives
Uplift BA capability, standards and methods across the organisation
Mentor and coach BAs, supporting a consistent and mature BA practice
Facilitate workshops, requirement sessions and process improvement activities
Analyse, document and communicate business requirements, user stories and process maps

You will have:

Proven experience as a Senior Business Analyst across complex enterprise environments
Demonstrated ability to uplift BA capability, frameworks and practice maturity
Strong facilitation, communication and stakeholder engagement skills
Experience translating business needs into clear, actionable artefacts
Exposure to salary packaging, novated leasing or financial services (nice to have)

What's in it for you:

Focus on work-life balance & wellbeing
Career growth and learning
Strong workplace culture

For more information please contact on sarah.jprdan@talentinternational.com

AEMO at the Heart of Energy  

AEMO is Australia’s independent energy system and market operator and system planner. AEMO’s purpose is to ensure safe, reliable and affordable energy today, and enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians.  Australian governments are now committed to a net zero economy for Australia by 2050 and our vision is to enable this. We have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-design the future of our energy systems, and our core values revolve around character, commitment, and connection. Join us as we contribute to this significant transition in the energy sector.    

About the role  

The Operations Division plays a critical role in AEMO's success, ensuring the secure and efficient functioning of Australia's wholesale and retail energy markets and systems. Within this division, the Gas Market Operations team oversees the monitoring and management of AEMO's east coast wholesale gas markets. The team's responsibilities include analysing and reporting key market events to stakeholders in publications and to industry forums. Additionally, the team provides support to market participants, responding to queries, actioning tasks and offering education on gas market operations. The team also engages with industry stakeholders and other business units within AEMO to implement market enhancements. 

You will make an important contribution to gas market operations, in the areas of affordability of gas to consumers and the security and reliability of gas. You will also focus on market monitoring, involving investigation, and reporting of outcomes in the wholesale gas markets, enabling AEMO and our stakeholders to make informed decisions. 

The role has potential to be included in an on-call roster to support markets outside of business hours and can be based in Brisbane or Melbourne. 

What you will be doing

Utilise problem-solving skills to analyse market operations to determine and report on the impact on participants of wholesale gas market outcomes and opportunities for market improvement. This will include contributing to preparing reports for publication on market events and present reports at forums/meetings on market outcomes.

Respond to inquiries and requests submitted by market participants, executing market specific tasks as outlined in established procedures.

Mentor and guide junior staff in their day-to-day activities.

Analyse data leveraging previous experience with Power BI dashboards, SQL queries or Python to streamline data extraction and reporting.

Develop skills in understanding the regulatory environment including the National Gas Law, National Gas Rules and relevant Market Procedures. 

What you will bring to the role

Bachelor’s degree or higher in economics, commerce, law, finance, information technology, engineering or a related discipline.

Experience working in the energy sector with an in-depth knowledge of AEMO gas markets.  

Experience in mentoring junior staff.

Capability to interpret, operate in compliance with and develop technical documents and/or procedures.

Proficiency in MS Office Suite, Power BI, SQL or Python, plus experience in IT/software requirements, design, testing, and change management would be an advantage. 

In return some of our benefits to you

Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options 

Professional development via projects, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and more. 

Give back with up to 4 days of volunteering leave per year.  

Reward your hard work with annual performance bonuses (subject to eligibility). 

Embrace a healthier you with our wellness program, discounted health insurance, gym perks and our comprehensive Employee Assistance Program (EAP).  

About Our Process 

At AEMO we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome people of all backgrounds, including people with disabilities and neurodivergence and those who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander. If you have any accessibility requirements to support you during the application or interview process, simply let us know by emailing us at talent@aemo.com.au

Category: Corporate Finance & Investment Banking (Banking & Financial Services)
Ad Text:
Why Work for St Vincent's Hospital Melbourne (SVHM)?

A collaborative, values-driven workplace culture
Ongoing development and career progression opportunities
Salary : HSUA 5 Grade 4 ($140k-$150k + Super)


About the Opportunity

We are seeking a proactive and collaborative Finance Business Partner to join our team in a pivotal role supporting one of Melbourne's largest public health services.


Reporting to the Manager, Financial Business Partnering, this role partners directly with executive directors, general managers, and clinical/non-clinical teams to provide high-level financial support that enables strategic decision-making, improves performance, and contributes to long-term financial sustainability.



As a trusted financial advisor, you will:


Lead financial strategy and performance improvement within the designated directorate
Drive cost savings initiatives and provide expert financial analysis
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for both finance and non-finance stakeholders
Positively challenge divisional financial performance and business planning
Manage, mentor and support one or more Finance Analysts


About You: Your Contribution


4+ years' experience in financial/business partnering, with exposure to senior stakeholders
Strong commercial acumen and ability to develop financial models and forecasts
Significant experience in strategic and operational financial planning in a large, complex setting
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to explain complex financial concepts simply
Experience developing, assessing and presenting business cases


What We Offer


Access to salary packaging and exclusive employee discounts
Fitness Passport - discounted access to gyms and fitness centres
Ongoing professional development and career advancement
A positive, supportive environment committed to innovation
Employee Assistance Program - confidential support services
Wellbeing initiatives and a vibrant campus culture
Convenient Fitzroy location with public transport at your doorstep

About the Finance Department

Based at our Fitzroy campus, the SVHM Finance Department includes teams across Financial Accounting, Accounts Payable, Revenue Services, Finance Systems and Business Partnering. The Business Partnering team works closely with senior clinical leaders and finance colleagues to support service delivery and organisational strategy. You'll join a highly regarded, friendly, and motivated team making a real impact in healthcare.



Working at SVHM

St Vincent's Hospital Melbourne is a leading public, teaching and research hospital and part of St Vincent's Health Australia - the nation's largest not-for-profit health and aged care provider. Rooted in our values of Compassion, Justice, Integrity and Excellence, we strive to serve our community with dignity and respect.



Application Process

Click "Apply" to submit your resume and cover letter.


For further information to know more about the role, please contact James Wardrop - Manager, Financial Business Partnering via email at james.wardrop@svha.org.au


Shortlisting will commence immediately. We may close this advertisement earlier if a suitable candidate is identified. We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible. So don't delay your application.

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, communities and abilities. Diversity and inclusion are integral to our mission and reflect the community we serve.

Note:
Employment at SVHM may be subject to mandatory immunisation requirements (e.g. flu, COVID-19), in line with our duty of care under Work Health and Safety legislation.

Job Title: Project Coordinator - Financial Services - Planview Automation & Improvement
Ad Text:
A global financial services firm seeks a highly analytical, results-driven Project Coordinator to join its greenfield project tooling implementation & upgrade program.

This critical role demands a professional with a strategic mindset, focusing on enhancing our delivery framework through expert tooling management and continuous process optimization. You will be instrumental in ensuring the efficiency and integrity of the new portfolio management tool that's being implemented. 
 
Must-Have Experience
 
To excel in this strategic role, candidates must demonstrate proven expertise in the following key areas:

Deep Tooling Proficiency: Minimum of 3+ years of hands-on, administrative-level experience with enterprise Project Portfolio Management (PPM) tools, specifically:
Jira: Expert configuration, workflow customization (Jira Service Desk/Jira Software), reporting (e.g., JQL), and integration with other corporate systems.
Planview: Strong working knowledge of Planview Enterprise or Planview LeanKit for resource planning, capacity management, and financial tracking.
Automation Development: Documented success in implementing automation scripts, rules, or workflows (e.g., using Jira Automation/ScriptRunner, or Power Automate) to eliminate manual processes and improve data quality.
Process Engineering: Direct experience in mapping, analyzing, and re-engineering complex project delivery processes within a highly regulated environment, preferably in financial services.
Portfolio Reporting: Demonstrated ability to consolidate, analyze, and present complex project and portfolio data, translating tooling metrics into actionable executive-level insights and recommendations.
Core Accountabilities:

Tooling Mastery: Serve as the subject-matter expert for Jira and Planview, ensuring optimal configuration, integration, and utilisation to enable accurate reporting and governance.
Automation Leadership: Proactively develop and deploy automation solutions within project workflows to minimize manual intervention and maximize data reliability.
Process Governance: Lead initiatives for process improvement, establishing robust, scalable, and auditable methodologies compliant with corporate standards.
Stakeholder Engagement: Facilitate effective communication and training for global project teams on best practices for tooling and process adherence.
The Ideal Candidate Possesses:

Demonstrated experience in a large-scale corporate or financial institution.
A proven track record of driving significant efficiency gains through automation and optimization.
Elevate your career by driving strategic change in a dynamic, high-stakes environment. Apply now to shape the future of project delivery.

 02 9063 1149
aheaton@lansonpartners.com - Apply via the link only, not to this email. Any questions re the role, send me an email.

Salary: Great salary, bonus, and endless chocolate!
Ad Text:
Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?
Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. 

Mondelēz International empowers people to snack right in over 150 countries around the world. We're leading the future of snacking with iconic global and local brands such as Oreo, Cadbury, Philadelphia, Pascall, The Natural Confectionery Company, Belvita, Ritz and Toblerone with global revenues exceeding $36 billion USD. 

The Opportunity

You will define and evolve our climate and environment-related disclosures, leveraging cross-functional programs and roadmaps to reflect our advancements. This is an exceptional opportunity to shape the future in a dynamic environment, where your openness to learn and grow will accelerate your sustainability career.

Our Mondelēz Finance BU is a highly collaborative powerhouse, serving as custodians of an incredible portfolio of brands cherished by millions worldwide. The sheer scale of our operations in Australia & New Zealand offers unparalleled career pathways and robust learning opportunities.

This role may be an opportunity for you to have more of a work life balance. We are open to a permanent part time incumbent.

About the Role:

Strategic Reporting: Develop and meticulously manage the organisation’s climate-related financial disclosure reporting processes.

Data Integrity & Transparency: Oversee the comprehensive collection, collation, verification, and transparent presentation of data pertaining to climate-related risks, opportunities, mitigation efforts, and greenhouse gas emissions.

Narrative development: Collaborate with sustainability, finance, risk, and external experts to craft compelling qualitative and quantitative disclosures on climate risks, mitigation strategies, and financial impacts across short, medium, and long-term horizons.

Cohesive Communication: Coordinate all climate and environment-related inputs for sustainability reporting and voluntary disclosures, ensuring consistency with our global 'Snacking Made Right Report'.

Policy & Procedure Enhancement: Develop and partner with process owners to enhance or establish robust policies and procedures, ensuring consistent and compliant climate and environment-related disclosures.

Timely Compliance: Prepare draft sustainability reports for thorough review, ensuring timely and compliant lodgement with all relevant regulatory bodies.

About You

A desire to drive your future, accelerate your career, and the following experience and knowledge:

Knowledge of Australia’s climate-related financial disclosure landscape

Demonstrated experience in sustainability/climate risk reporting, financial analysis, and risk management

Advanced analytical skills

Exceptional communication skills, enabling you to convey complex climate and financial concepts with clarity to both internal and external stakeholders

Proven ability in sound, well-structured analytical problem-solving

Strong project management capabilities

A tertiary qualification in Data Analytics, Sustainability, Environmental Management, or a related field

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

At Mondelez International, our mission is to provide consumers with the right snack, for the right moment, made in the right way. We are one of the largest snack companies in the world, with global net revenues exceeding $36 billion USD. 

We have operations in more than 80 countries and employ approximately 91,000 diverse and talented employees in our factories, offices, research & development facilities and distribution activities around the world.

In Australia and New Zealand, we have 6 factories, and both global and local brands, employing over 2,000 people; Cadbury Dairy Milk, Oreo, Toblerone, Philadelphia, belVita, Pascall, The Natural Confectionery Company, Sour Patch Kids and Ritz.

Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Title: Senior Finance Business Partner | Large Corporate | Melbourne CBD
Ad Text:
Job Description
Reporting to the Head of FP&A the successful candidate will lead in the development and improvement of the commercial reporting which aids the decision making of senior executives within the business. Stakeholder engagement (with internal and external decision makers) is a key element of this role in order to ensure timely and accurate reporting of the organisation's budgeting and forecasting. Key responsibilities include: 

Drive the groups strategy across the FP&A function
Manage delivery of FP&A across the group 
Ownership of the monthly reporting, managing deadlines and providing variance analysis
Feeding back results on analysis back to the wider operational business and ensuring the continuing improvement and value of the business
Identifying areas of potential risk, under-performance, improvement and other opportunity and work with other areas of business to mitigate or promote these
Ensuring financial governance systems are fit for purpose and monitoring framework adherence and delivery
Identifying business risks and proactively managing these
Strategy, demonstrating insight and knowledge of the market place and drivers with in the industry. Working closely with management to design the strategy, service and delivery
The Successful Applicant
CA/CPA qualified with a Big 4 or Mid-Tier upbringing, this role demands excellent communication skills, proven stakeholder management experience and a desire to improve existing analysis tools and reporting. 
 
About Our Client
An Australian success story which has grown to a multi-billion dollar organisation in only a number of years. Melbourne head office with a high performing and tight knit finance function. 
 
What's on Offer
• CBD location 
• Permanent role
• $150,000 + super + 15% Bonus
• Flexible working week (Working from home 3 days per week)
